text: one New Year's Eve people were running
around trying to make it somewhere the
stingy old grumpy man mr. Scrooge was
looking at the window from his workplace
What nonsense all these people running
around in the cold I hate New Year's Eve
mr. Scrooge sat at his table and began
to check the list of all the people that
owed him money with hesitation his
helper approached him and asked is it
possible that I leave a little early
today you know it's New Year's Eve and I
must buy my son a presents though you
may not mr. present how ridiculous and
why leave it to the last day you should
have bought it earlier with great
sadness his helper returned to work at
that very moment a door knocked as
grumpy as himself his dog barked at the
door mr. Scrooge's helper opened the
door his young nephew had come to visit
him
he invited him over to the New Year's
dinner because mr. Scrooge didn't like
New Year's and he thought that the
celebrations were nonsense once again
like always he refused to go after his
nephew had left his door knocked again
Oh what now leave me alone so I can work
this time two men entered and asked if
it was possible for him to donate some
money to the orphans mr. Scrooge refused
to give them money go on now go go to
another door I have no money to draw on
the streets with great sadness the men
walked out later that evening mr.
Scrooge went home wore his pajamas
and sat on his couch and tried that
moment some strange things began to
happen windows and doors began to swing
there were howling noises coming from
the door and scary sounds all around the
dog began to bark once again at first
mr. Scrooge didn't take any notice of
this then all of a sudden a ghost
appeared right in front of him
[Music]
mr. Scrooge had never been so frightened
in his whole entire life the ghost was
his friend from work who had just passed
away with great difficulty mr. Scrooge
spoke yeah you but how can it be you
died go get away from you leave me alone
anything wrong ghosts hands and feet

due to his selfishness and greediness he

to walk around the world in shackles and
so involved with this rule not to make
the same mistake he did you go and mind
your business your dad there you have it
okay then just wanted to warn you
three other goals will visit you one of
them will show you your past the other
your presence and the last one will show

as if none of this had happened and head
off to bed soon after a light caught his
eye
when mr. Scrooge opened his eyes a child

last year's New Year's Eve mr. Scrooge
was stunned
ah now we will take a little trip to the
past
Oh what's up bullying help a ghost
took mr. Scrooge back to his childhood
ears and there it was mr. Scrooge as a

you could tell child mr. Scrooge was
very happy Oh later on the ghosts took

mr. Scrooge's wife was also there
together they were dancing and having so

Scrooge back to another New Year's Eve
which was in the past but later on in

used to have so much fun you used to
care for me and loved me but now only
love is money I have no room in your

being able to stand the sight of this
mr. Scrooge asked the goes to take him

round a giant green covered ghost

now mr. Scrooge was even more scared it

let's see what's happening this New

Scrooge for giving me the opportunity to

able to eat because of him even though
mr. Scrooge was nasty to his helper at
every chance he got
it was amazed at how thankful he was
later he noticed his helpers sick child
the kid was sitting in his wheelchair at

he looked thin and sick
mr. Scrooge was very sad for the child
this child is very ill and hasn't got

Scrooge's sadness brew began later on

all his family was having so much fun
eating they even had an empty seat
waiting for him wish uncle was here with
us
mr. Scrooge did not expect to see this
he always thought that his whole family
had hated him at that moment the ghost

and have revealed to kids standing under

unconcerned people when it is time for

it was midnight this time their repeater

funeral

that moment mr. Scrooge realized that

anymore people who already money were

help son's grave
unlike his his son's grave was full of

please take me back now I understand I'm

first I visited the butcher he bought a
